decks.notes: This deck focuses on establishing control over the game through a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers. By disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also gaining card advantage through cards like Omen of the Sea and Champion of Wits, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually close out the game with powerful finishers like Elspeth, Sun's Nemesis. The mana base is constructed to support the three-color combination of black, white, and blue efficiently, ensuring consistent access to the necessary colors for the deck's spells.

The deck focuses on a Simic Aggro strategy, utilizing creatures with disruptive abilities to control the board and pressure the opponent. It also incorporates card draw and counter spells to maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck has a strong focus on tempo, using cards like Merfolk Trickster and Brazen Borrower to slow down the opponent while continuing to develop its own board. Additionally, the inclusion of Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx provides the potential for explosive plays and additional mana ramp.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through the library, using cards like Dig Through Time and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand, and then winning the game by getting Thassa's Oracle onto the battlefield and using its ability to win the game if your library is empty. Narset, Parter of Veils helps to dig deeper into the library while also disrupting the opponent's draw power. Jace, Wielder of Mysteries provides an alternative win condition if needed. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently through a powerful combo strategy.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while using powerful pump spells like Embercleave to finish off the game quickly. The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Voltaic Brawler, Gruul Spellbreaker, and Pelt Collector to apply pressure early on, supported by Burn spells like Bonecrusher Giant. The deck also includes some versatile threats like Hazoret the Fervent and Domri Rade to provide additional value and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to curve out smoothly and deliver a swift victory through relentless aggression.

The main strategy of this Dimir Inverter deck is to utilize cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries, and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by drawing your entire deck and emptying your library. By using cards like Inverter of Truth and Dig Through Time, the deck can manipulate the order of cards in your library to achieve this win condition. In addition, disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help to control the board and protect your combo pieces until you can execute your game plan.

The primary goal of this Dimir Inverter deck is to manipulate the library by using cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Inverter of Truth in order to win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's hand with cards like Thought Erasure and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing cards like Dig Through Time and Fatal Push for additional advantage. The mana base is designed to support the dual-color requirements of the deck, allowing for consistency in casting spells and setting up the combo win condition.

Utilizing card advantage, disruption, and self-mill mechanics to consistently and efficiently bring out the Inverter of Truth and win through the effect of Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Thassa's Oracle. The deck aims to control the early game with Thoughtseize and interaction, before assembling the combo pieces and closing out the game with the alternate win conditions. It focuses on manipulating the graveyard while maintaining control over the opponent's hand and board state, ultimately leading to a powerful combo finish.

The primary focus of this deck is to flood the board with low-cost creatures and use additional mana generation from Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Idyllic Grange to empower the synergies within the deck. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful white creatures and enchantments to apply pressure on the opponent quickly, with cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit providing additional benefits to the overall strategy. The inclusion of cards like Knight of the White Orchid and Walking Ballista help to maintain board presence and control, while Stasis Snare and Gideon's Intervention offer protection and removal options.

The main concept of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to ramp up quickly through generating green mana with Nykthos, Forests, and mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic. The deck utilizes cards like Voracious Hydra and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive green creatures. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Karn, the Great Creator for added utility and card advantage. The inclusion of Castle Garenbrig allows for additional mana ramp and efficient casting of high-cost cards.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Lotus Field with Hidden Strings and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to generate infinite mana. By utilizing Underworld Breach to recur spells from the graveyard and Thassa's Oracle as a win condition, the deck aims to quickly win the game through a powerful combo engine. With card selection and acceleration from cards like Pore Over the Pages and Arboreal Grazer, the deck is designed to quickly assemble its key pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a lethal combination of mana generation and card advantage.

This Temur Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. It also includes disruptive elements like Kozilek's Return and Elder Deep-Fiend to control the board and slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck takes advantage of graveyard synergy with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Champion of Wits, and uses a mix of creatures and spells to maintain control of the game and ultimately overpower the opponent.

This Green ramp deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful creatures and spells, while also controlling the opponent's board with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck utilizes cards like Nissa's Pilgrimage and Wolfwillow Haven to accelerate mana production, allowing for early plays of high-cost threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck also includes cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Cavalier of Thorns to provide card advantage and board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana with cards like Nissa's Pilgrimage and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while controlling the board with cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to quickly establish a strong mana base with green ramp spells and utilize powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the game. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Arboreal Grazer to help filter through the deck and find key pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Rabblemaster, along with burn spells like Wild Slash and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell provide additional pressure and damage boosts, while Castle Embereth and Ramunap Ruins offer late-game reach. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Eidolon of the Great Revel to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on quick and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. With a mix of aggressive one-drop creatures like Rakdos Cackler and Knight of the Ebon Legion, alongside resilient threats like Scrapheap Scrounger and Murderous Rider, the deck aims to control the board and reduce the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. Thoughtseize provides disruption and helps to clear the way for the aggressive creatures to attack. Rankle, Master of Pranks adds a versatile threat that can disrupt the opponent's game plan while dealing damage.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, efficient creatures while utilizing powerful enchantments and planeswalkers to control the board and gain incremental advantages. The deck focuses on building a wide board presence quickly and leveraging Heliod, Sun-Crowned to pump up your creatures and generate extra value. By utilizing Castle Ardenvale and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx for additional mana sources, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.
